entry.title: atom bomb first test
entry.content:
i decided to push a repository on github with all those tests and notes that can maybe become a project some day and named it labo.

this feed is generated with atom bomb and the feed file i just maintain manually with vim and simple zsh helper to create headers.

atom bomb (i'm not sure about the name) is written in perl5 and Eirotic.pm (not released yet because dzil don't want :)), which replace my common boilerplate:

  • Perlude
  • Method::Signatures
  • perl 5.14 with strictures
  • YAML

markdown conversion is made by pandoc.

entry.title: new (experimental) atom feed
entry.content:
few months ago, i decided to experiment make and pandoc and git as a minimalistic blog/wiki engine (werc was on my list too) to replace jekyll (i was a fan of ruby until i tried it).

now i'm totally happy with the basics and i need to extend:

  • comment posts via sending an email to the list
  • see comments by viewing archives
  • a simple way to maintain feeds. i wrote a little perl script to test it
